That's great! Word-of-mouth recommendations are one of the best ways to discover new podcasts. "Crime Junkie" has a very engaging and relatable dynamic, which is part of its appeal. The hosts, Ashley and Brit, have a great chemistry and a passion for true crime that's infectious.

If you're looking for more podcasts with a similar dynamic, you might also want to try:

1. **Wine & Crime**: A true crime podcast hosted by three friends, Amanda, Kenyon, and Lucy. They have a similar banter and humor to "Crime Junkie," and often cover cases with a focus on wine and pop culture.
2. **Red Wine and Crime**: Another true crime podcast with a similar name, but a different dynamic. Hosted by three friends, Erica, Nicole, and Tina, they cover a wide range of cases with a focus on humor and wine.
3. **Crime and Roses**: A true crime podcast hosted by two friends, Nicole and Taren. They have a similar dynamic to "Crime Junkie," with a focus on humor, pop culture, and a touch of sass.

These podcasts all have a similar vibe to "Crime Junkie," with a focus on friendship, humor, and true crime. Of course, each has its own unique style and tone, but if you enjoy the dynamic of "Crime Junkie," you might find something to love in these podcasts as well.

Let me know what you think of these recommendations, and if you have any other questions or need more suggestions!
